title: What's a song that gets better the more you listen to it? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: I Was All Over Her by Salvia Palth. It's a very dark and ambient sounding song that isn't quantized exactly correctly, making it seem like just white noise the first time you listen to it. But after you listen deeply to the mumbly lyrics and the slow, drunk drums, guitar, and bass, you will understand the song and it's meaning aswell as all the minor intricacies and the beauty of the song. It is my favorite song and I have listened to it more than any other, and that's only while conscious. Whilst sleeping, I've listened to it more than it is fathomable, on repeat every night.

It’s none other than Icy by ITZY.  I used to hate ICY. But as time went by, I started listening to it a few more times, and soon enough, I was addicted to listening to the song. The part “ They keep talking, I keep walking! Dadeul Blah Blah “ was great. To be honest, all of ITZY’S songs get better the more I listen to it, but ICY applies the most, in this case.
